node.title: Solomon Islands PM's compound targeted by rioters, one building damaged by fire and looters
node.description: Prime Minister Sogavare's residence is under heavy police watch as protests continue for a third day, with more Australian police and troops to arrive in the capital, Honiara, later today.Â
node.content:
["A building belonging to the Solomon Islands Prime Minister has been set on fire by protesters, with looters breaking in and causing damage.\u00a0", "Images from social media show the fire-damaged building in Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare's compound, with items strewn everywhere.", "The building set alight is a second home that had been previously rented out and\u00a0is not the Prime Minister's main residence, which has been declared safe but is under heavy police watch.", "Honiara-based freelance journalist\u00a0Chrisnrita Aumanu-Leong said though the city was visibly quieter today, crowds had turned their attention to Mr Sogavare's residence.", "", "
Rioters say they\u00a0\"just wanted to do something to\" the Prime Minister's\u00a0property.(ABC News:\u00a0Chrisnrita Aumanu-Leong)
", "Papua New Guinea has deployed 20 police officers and 15 corrections officers\u00a0to the troubled nation by request from the Solomon Islands' government.", "They were expected to arrive Friday afternoon, according to PNG Prime Minister James Marape's\u00a0office.", "", "
The main compound of the Solomon Islands' Prime Minister.(ABC News: Chrisnrita Aumanu-Leong)
", "PNG Police Commissioner David Manning will also be accompanying the security personnel to assess the situation on the ground and hold a press conference later this evening.\u00a0", "On Thursday, a contingent of 23 Australian Federal Police (AFP) officers arrived in Honiara to bolster the Solomons'\u00a0police force, with more to follow in the coming days.", "Up to 50 AFP officers\u00a0and 40 ADF personnel will arrive in\u00a0Solomon Islands later today.", "It's the third day of protests in the capital Honiara, with people continuing to call for\u00a0Mr Sogavare's resignation.", "The protests in the country erupted earlier this week \u2014 the main, but not sole, source of the conflict is the government's decision to switch diplomatic allegiance from Taiwan to China.", "The Solomon Islands' Ministry of Public Service has\u00a0advised all public servants \u2014\u00a0with the exception of essential services \u2014\u00a0to stay home due to the current unrest in the capital.", "It also encouraged public servants to ensure they had\u00a0enough food supplies at home due to the uncertainty of the present situation."]
